text:
"We recommended that Congress consider comprehensive legislation on internet privacy that would enhance consumer protections and include the oversight authorities agencies should have” @USGAO
https://t.co/aKd757VmX3

@philw1982 @garry_knight @PaulThomasrn @jprnyct @IanJon407 @ClarkeMicah I don’t think the vendor gets that info at point of sale. Freedom of information and privacy is a complicated area though, and there is a lot of information being collected about types of consumer aggregated. You’re on a platform now that it collects it for instance.

@OMGTheMess 20. Price point is still way too high for the majority of consumers. That is unlikely to change given how rare the raw materials for a smart phone on wheels are. Throw in consumer concerns over privacy, & big tech backed government overreach, even 20 years is wishful thinking.
RT @kelrobi11: Watching @emilychangtv on Bloomberg today and heard that Twitter is a bit like Meta | Facebook in that they know where you a…

Watching @emilychangtv on Bloomberg today and heard that Twitter is a bit like Meta | Facebook in that they know where you are and keep data on you, including your other social media. Definitely time for a consumer privacy law. And ban stalking by police please (how info is used)

Did you know that in 2023 Google will completely phase out third-party cookies as rules continue to tighten around consumer privacy. Marketers are being forced to reevaluate their strategies in order to remain compliant and maintain consumer trust. https://t.co/nlCpteF5o8

McKinsey: Consumer faith in cybersecurity, data privacy, and responsible AI hinges on what companies do today -- and establishing this digital trust just might lead to business growth https://t.co/NPPWnpungW - #tech #security #trends

RT @Corix_JC: Chief #Marketing Officers should engage in consumer data #privacy initiatives >> https://t.co/l6fiqvq5Tk on @VentureBeat
